tool_input.query: "Folwark zwierzęcy" krytyka literacka Polska "Pamiętnik Literacki" "Teksty Drugie" academia uniwersytet

tool_response.query: "Folwark zwierzęcy" krytyka literacka Polska "Pamiętnik Literacki" "Teksty Drugie" academia uniwersytet
results: I'll search for Polish literary criticism of "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) in academic journals and university sources.

I found several academic sources discussing George Orwell's "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) in Polish literary criticism:

## Academic Papers and Journals:

"Pamiętnik Literacki" published an article titled "ANGIELSKA FARMA ZWIERZĘCA I POLSKA FOLWARK ZWIERZĘCY. O SPECYFICE PRZEKŁADU JANINY DACKIEWICZ" (2019) by Anna Cetera-Włodarczyk and Alicja Kosim from the University of Warsaw.(no content)This article examines the specifics of Janina Dackiewicz's Polish translation of Orwell's work.(no content)Another publication in "Pamiętnik Literacki" is "Pieskie życie na folwarku i za granicą. Zwierzęce motywacje Zbigniewa Herberta" (2020) by Marcin Całbecki.(no content)This article analyzes animal motivations in literature, including references to Orwell's work.

## University Resources:

Academia.edu hosts an article by Magdalena Cornis-Pope from Nicolaus Copernicus University titled "George Orwell, „Folwark zwierzęcy"."(no content)The article discusses how Orwell's novel is "jedną z najbardziej znanych antyutopii napisanych w XX wieku" (one of the most well-known dystopias written in the 20th century).(no content)The University of Białystok repository contains a scholarly work titled "Świat stworzony przez człowieka, ale bez człowieka w powieści George'a Orwella Folwark zwierzęcy" (2017) by Wioleta Olchowik, which analyzes the paradox of a world created by humans but existing without humans in Orwell's novel.

## Translation Studies:

Academia.edu also features "Marta Kaźmierczak's Review of: Anna Cetera-Włodarczyk & Alicja Kosim (2019). Angielska „Farma zwierzęca" i polski „Folwark zwierzęcy"..."(no content)This review discusses the translation analysis published by Wydawnictwo Uniwersytetu Warszawskiego.

These sources demonstrate that "Folwark zwierzęcy" has been extensively analyzed in Polish academic circles, particularly focusing on translation studies, allegorical interpretations, and its significance as a dystopian work in Polish literary criticism.
